abstract: The broader reach of regulations, intended to keep companies from cutting deals to move income overseas, appears to have caught many by surprise.
snippet: The broader reach of regulations, intended to keep companies from cutting deals to move income overseas, appears to have caught many by surprise.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer plans to abandon its $152 billion merger with Allergan — the largest deal yet aimed at helping an American company shed its United States corporate citizenship for a lower tax bill — just days after the Obama administration introduced new tax rules, a person briefed on the matter said late Tuesday.

headline.main: Pfizer and Allergan Are Said to End Merger as Tax Rules Tighten
headline.print_headline: Pfizer and Allergan Said to End Merger as Tax Rules Tighten

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Leslie Picker
